src:
Генсек НАТО не стал встречаться с моряками Украины, вернувшимися из РФ

02 Nov 2019, 14:27

Генеральный секретарь НАТО Йенс Столтенберг отказался встречаться с украинскими моряками в Одессе, которые были задержаны в Керченском проливе.
Как заявили источники издания "Зеркало недели", в альянсе отказались от идеи проведения встречи главы военного блока и моряков.
Утверждается, что главным противником организации встречи стали представители Франции. Париж высказался против идеи, поскольку такая встреча главы НАТО с моряками может "сорвать мирный процесс и негативно повлиять на организацию переговоров в "нормандском формате", сообщает "Страна.ua".
Глава НАТО Столтенберг находился с визитом в Киеве в конце октября. Он провел встречу с президентом Зеленским, а также выступил в Верховной раде.
Три корабля ВМС Украины 25 ноября 2018 года совершили провокацию в Керченском проливе, вторгшись в территориальные воды РФ и направившись через Керченский пролив. Погранслужба России и ФСБ вынуждены была задержать украинские суда и почти 30 моряков.
text:
Jahromi: Value added companies announce how many jobs they have created

02 Nov 2019, 14:07

The Minister of Communication and Information Technology said: "If data sharing does not happen in the city's smart domain, a monopoly will occur and a situation similar to that of value-added companies will arise, companies that even one person does not know the name of but which claims; They have created thousands of jobs.
According to IRNA, Mohammad Javad Azari Jahromi said at the Smart Cities Panel on Saturday at the Tehran Golden Brick Awards event: "Putting the foundation for change on the basis of citizens will make significant progress." People in cities pay taxes to municipalities to get good services.
He added: As the trend of urbanization in the world is increasing and by the year it reaches 4, our metropolises are getting bigger and urbanization problems in the areas of transportation, traffic, pollution, waste disposal and problems Environmental issues are what people are dealing with.
Azeri Jahromi said: Professor Baltazar is all areas of IT, the solution of urban intelligence is not a slogan or a decor for some officials. Today, without smartphones, it is impossible to control large cities like Tehran, Isfahan and Mashhad.
The Minister of Communications pointed out that if the municipality fails to detect pollution, traffic and such issues every day, management will be blind. Technology has come to be called IoT to implement these issues. Big data technology has come to analyze data, all of which must be output to improve people's lives.
"If we run a project that doesn't make a difference in people's lives, it will be tax evasion," he said. We should always ask ourselves what is the outcome of the program we are implementing.
Azeri Jahromi added: "The real added value is to open up urban data so that young people can make a fortune out of it." If the data is made available to a specific group, it will not lead to people's satisfaction.
Unless data sharing is done in a principled manner, something like the one in value-added services will occur, where many numbers are exchanged annually.
"Unless in the market of 4 billion tomans a year, people will not even know a single major player in this field," he said. When we talk about combating value-added scams, advocates have announced that thousands of jobs will be lost by the end of value-added. If so many jobs were created, how would any people even know the name of one of these value-added companies?
The Minister of Communications emphasized: If data liberalization and creativity sharing are not put in place, there will be no tangible result, considering the role of intelligence in delivering services to the public in a transparent manner.
This year's motto of the Tehran Golden Globe Award is to create smart cities that are sustainable for everyone.
World Cities Day was selected on the recommendation of the United Nations Economic and Investment Committee to further collaborate with various cities around the world to strengthen urban infrastructure, local governance and urban management and other vital areas to address the consequences of urban change in different communities.
